author: Jeff Mack
text: A frog has a series of narrow escapes in this lively romp written using only two letters.
title: Ah Ha!

Publisher: Simon & Schuster Books for Young Readers
author: Jon Scieszka and Mac Barnett
text: What's a boy to do when he receives a syrupy sweet story as a gift? Transform it into an epic fight between the forces of good and evil, of course!
title: Battle Bunny

author: Patricia Polacco
text: "This tea set is magic. Anyone who drinks from it has a blessing from God." The story of the author's great-grandmother and the people who helped her escape from Russia.
title: The Blessing Cup

author: Molly Idle
text: A wordless, lift-the-flap story of two very different dancers who find a way to overcome their differences through balletic movement.
title: Flora and the Flamingo

author: Rebecca Dudley
text: Lovingly crafted figures set in a gentle forest tell the tale of Hank and the hummingbird egg he comes to care for. A wordless charmer.
title: Hank Finds an Egg

author: Gus Gordon
text: City life can be busy, bustling... and lonely. Two musicians find a satisfying friendship in this musical journey set in New York City.
title: Herman and Rosie

author: Jason Carter Eaton
text: Want a puppy? Why not consider a train instead? A guide to capturing a locomotive of your very own.
title: How to Train a Train

author: Aaron Becker
text: Luminous illustrations chart an ordinary child's adventure through an extraordinary world.
title: Journey

Publisher: Little, Brown Books for Young Readers
author: Daniel Beaty
text: A moving portrait of a child in the wake of an absent parent, told against the backdrop of New York City.
title: Knock Knock: My Dad's Dream for Me

author: Paul Fleischman
text: Small mementos capture entire stories in this remarkable journey of an immigrant grandfather's life.
title: The Matchbox Diary

author: Adam Rex
text: Hush now—the moon has come down to Earth, the sun is nowhere to be seen...and now the tide is 3 rising. A tale for dozy times with glimmering nighttime scenes.
title: Moonday

Publisher: Little, Brown Books for Young Readers
author: Peter Brown
text: Uptight society is in for a change when Mr. Tiger goes back to his jungle instincts. It's Wilderness vs. City. Which will win?
title: Mr. Tiger Goes Wild!

author: Tameka Fryer Brown
text: Jamie goes from gentle green and hungry yellow to moody black and stormy gray in a single day.
title: My Cold Plum Lemon Pie Bluesy Mood

author: Yuyi Morales
text: Fwap! Slish! Bloop! Krunch! A young boy imagines himself wrestling and defeating out-of-this-world contenders, but when it comes to las hermanitas, he may have finally met his match.
title: Niño Wrestles the World

author: Zachariah OHora
text: A toddler tames her gorilla friend in this sweet tale of tantrums, tears, and banana ice cream.
title: No Fits, Nilson!

author: Duncan Tonatiuh
text: A young rabbit sets out on a mission north to find his missing father, and crosses paths with a hungry coyote.
title: Pancho Rabbit and the Coyote: A Migrant's Tale

author: Barbara Reid
text: "There is more than one way to picture a tree." A lushly illustrated ode to trees in all their glorious forms.
title: Picture a Tree

author: Bob Graham
text: From a soldier's goodbye to a blackbird's lunch on a path, Graham shows all that can happen in a single moment in time.
title: The Silver Button

author: Deborah Freedman
text: An uptight snail and an adventurous fish start a new story together in this warmhearted tale of friendship.
title: The Story of Fish and Snail

author: Aaron Meshon
text: Whether you call it baseball or yakyu, the fun of the game is the same. Join one boy as he enjoys a day at the diamond on opposite sides of the world.
title: Take Me Out to the Yakyu

author: Jacqueline Woodson
text: An intergenerational tale that follows a family as they move from rural South Carolina to Brooklyn.
title: This Is the Rope: A Story from the Great Migration

author: Bob Shea
text: Goat used to think he was pretty cool until that Unicorn came along. But how can you compete with a guy who can make it rain cupcakes?
title: Unicorn Thinks He's Pretty Great

author: Emily Jenkins
text: Water, water everywhere—to swim, to splash, to drink. One day in the life of a park, told with aquatic flair.
title: Water in the Park: A Book About Water and the Times of Day

author: Doug Hansen
text: Dynamic retellings and richly written American nature scenes give new life to 15 lesser-known and familiar fables.
title: Aesop in California

author: Ashley Bryan
text: This rhythmic read-aloud tells the story of a wild and fearless little boy who boldly faces down his two- and three-headed giant foes. An exuberantly illustrated trickster tale.
title: Can't Scare Me!

author: Hugh Lupton and Daniel Morden
text: Classic Greek stories get new life in these lyrically written early chapter tales. Rich, bold Colors reference ancient Grecian art. See also: Theseus and the Minotaur and Orpheus and Eurydice.
title: Demeter and Persephone

author: Chitra Banerjee Divakaruni
text: Leaving home to visit her daughter on the other side of the jungle, a cunning grandmother must use her wits to escape the jaws of hungry jungle beasts. Vivid illustrations bring this classic tale to life.
title: Grandma and the Great Gourd: A Bengali Folktale

author: Fran Parnell
text: A harried king turns his naughty daughters into oranges for a year and a day, but when monsters try to steal the tasty fruit can the princesses save themselves?
title: Grim, Grunt and Grizzle-Tail: A Story from Chile

author: The Brothers Grimm
text: Follow two clever siblings through these intricately designed, translucent pages. A classic Grimm Brothers tale gets an all-new look in this stunning retelling.
title: Hansel and Gretel

author: Odile Weulersse
text: The villagers always find something new to scold Nasreddine and his father about each week on their way to market. How can one boy please everyone, yet still stay true to himself?
title: Nasreddine

author: Judy Goldman
text: From Señor Puma's grand battle to the high purpose of fleas, this brilliant collection covers folktales from all over Mexico, illuminating the rich heritage of several of the country's diverse civilizations.
title: Whiskers, Tails and Wings: Animal Folktales from Mexico

author: Hope Vestergaard
text: Watch these mighty machines as they plow, excavate, and clean up the city. Colorsful cartoon illustrations feature trucks of both genders.
title: Digger, Dozer, Dumper

author: Amy Ludwig VanDerwater
text: Stop. Pause. Take a closer look at a forest through the seasons as you spy all kinds of flora and fauna. Soft waterColors show us the diversity of this woodland ecosystem.
title: Forest Has a Song: Poems

author: Jack Prelutsky
text: Meet the Jollyfish, who are always happy, and the Panteaters, who have a hankering for tasty trousers. Unusual dioramas of mishmashed creatures draw readers into a hilarious world of words and ideas.
title: Stardines Swim High Across the Sky and Other Poems

author: Calef Brown
text: Inventive verse and sweetly bizarre illustrations showcase poems of love and friendship.
title: We Go Together!: A Curious Selection of Affectionate Verse

author: Joyce Sidman
text: Lyrical poems take on the big and small moments in kids' lives. Illuminated with whimsical drawings, the verses highlight moments of grief, hope, and gym class.
title: What the Heart Knows: Chants, Charms and Blessings

author: J. Patrick Lewis
text: A group of accomplished artists illustrates inspiring stories of protest and change from around the world. Meet 17 uncommon activists of the past and present, including Sylvia Mendez and Harvey Milk.
title: When Thunder Comes: Poems for Civil Rights Leaders
tagsold: Heroism, History, True Story, Challenges, Identity, eBook

author: Kurt Cyrus
text: "Freddie picked his nose and now he's dead, dead, dead." Poetry bound to get stuck inside your head, head, head.
title: Your Skeleton Is Showing: Rhymes of Blunder from Six Feet Under

author: Miriam Glassman
text: Paige Turner has decided that this year she's going to be different. From now on, she's going to be brave! She's going to be talented! She's going to be... Oklahoma!
title: Call Me Oklahoma!

author: Neil Gaiman
text: Returning from the store in time for breakfast can be tricky when you're facing vengeful aliens, volcanic sacrifices, and a time-traveling stegosaurus. Hang on to that milk!
title: Fortunately, the Milk
tagsold: Families, Adventure, Alternate Reality, Fantasy, Humor, Quests, Boys, eBook

author: Rhode Montijo
text: Gabby Gomez loves gum, but after a bubble hits a power line and bursts, she becomes Gum Girl! Just try to pull yourself away from this stretchy, sticky comic adventure.
title: The Gumazing Gum Girl!: Chews Your Destiny
tagsold: Heroism, Adventure, Humor, Fantasy, Sci Fi, Girls, School

author: Josh Schneider
text: When a boy that Dana taunts gives her a white elephant as a gift, she comes to realize that sometimes the best gifts need to be shared.
title: The Meanest Birthday Girl

author: Mal Peet and Elspeth Graham
text: Can a blind desert guide and his adopted granddaughter save three lost travelers who face a coming sand storm? Stunning art captures the beauty and vastness of the Sahara.
title: Mysterious Traveler

author: Ali Sparkes
text: Josh and Danny Phillips are twins who have nothing in common. But when their mad scientist neighbor accidentally turns them into spiders, they'll have to learn how to work as a team.
title: S.W.I.T.C.H.: Spider Stampede

author: Patricia MacLachlan
text: Robbie's eccentric grandmother eats doughnuts for dinner and gets along with the woodland animals. With her wit and wisdom, Robbie comes to understand himself and his emotionally distant mother.
title: The Truth of Me

author: Monica Edinger
text: Margru becomes entangled in the debate surrounding the institution of slavery. A Historyly inspired fictional memoir that follows this kidnapped child from the west coast of Africa to New England and back again.
title: Africa Is My Home: A Child of the Amistad

Publisher: Little, Brown Books for Young Readers
author: Diana López
text: When her mother is diagnosed with breast cancer, Erica Montenegro's world is turned upside down. A family's struggles handled with humor and sensitivity.
title: Ask My Mood Ring How I Feel

Publisher: Simon & Schuster Books for Young Readers
author: Tim Federle
text: Thirteen-year-old Nate yearns for the bright lights of the theater. What he's got is small town Pennsylvania, where nobody understands his dream. An open casting call for a Broadway musical just might be his big break...if he can make it to the stage on time.
title: Better Nate Than Ever
tagsold: NYC, Identity, Realism, Humor, Adventure, Quests, eBook

author: David Almond
text: When his ambitious (and slightly unhinged) uncle turns his home into a fish canning factory, Stanley Potts runs away to join a traveling fair and discovers his destiny.
title: The Boy Who Swam with Piranhas

author: Holly Goldberg Sloan
text: Willow Chance is a 12-year-old genius who loves her gardens, diagnosing medical conditions, 9 and counting by 7s. When Willow is orphaned, she's set adrift in a world of events that she doesn't completely understand.
title: Counting by 7s
tagsold: Families, Identity, Tearjerkers, Friendship, Realism, eBook

author: Holly Black
text: A creepy china doll, a quest to lay its ghost to rest, and three friends on the verge of growing up go on their last childhood adventure together.
title: Doll Bones

author: Katie Quirk
text: In this 1967 Tanzanian mystery, 13-year-old Shida's village votes to join a larger community. When somebody starts sabotaging their new home, Shida must discover who's behind the mayhem.
title: A Girl Called Problem

author: Merrie Haskell
text: Tilda never imagined herself as the adventurous type. But when an ambitious cousin tries to imprison her, she escapes with her friends on a quest that will show that this reluctant princess has mettle.
title: Handbook for Dragon Slayers

author: Catherine Jinks
text: What dark things lurk in the shadows of Victorian London? It's all in a day's work for young Birdie, who draws out monsters for her master to kill. But not all monsters are supernatural, and when children start going missing, Birdie must put a stop to it.
title: How to Catch a Bogle

author: Jonathan Stroud
text: When the dead haunt the living in ghost-laden England, call on Lockwood & Co.! Lucy Carlyle is the newest member of the young group of spooky spirit hunters, but the trio is about to embark on its most hair-raising case ever!
title: Lockwood & Co.: The Screaming Staircase
tagsold: Alternate Reality, Mystery, Adventure, Creepy, Fantasy, eBook

author: Amy Timberlake
text: Everyone thinks Georgie's sister Agatha is dead except Georgie. But when she heads out into the 1871 wilderness of Wisconsin with her trusty gun, she discovers that the truth may turn out to be a whole lot more complicated than she ever dreamed.
title: One Came Home
tagsold: Families, Mystery, Historical Fiction, Tales of Courage, Quests, eBook

author: Krista Russell
text: Before slaves escaped north, they escaped south to Florida. It's 1739 and 13-year-old Jem wants to fight for the Spanish king. But when the fighting comes to him, it's nothing at all like what he expected.
title: The Other Side of Free
tagsold: Historical Fiction, Multicultural, Tales of Courage

author: Jarrett J. Krosoczka
text: Something's rotten in Kalamazoo City, and it's not just the illegal fish. Join hotshot rookie Rick Zengo on his first case as he takes on an uncommonly clever crime kingpin.
title: Platypus Police Squad: The Frog Who Croaked

author: Anne Ursu
text: Eleven-year-old Oscar likes the quiet routine of working for the local magician, Master Caleb. But when a plague strikes the city and a new type of magic affects the island, Oscar's world shatters. Now one small boy may hold the answers to saving the city.
title: The Real Boy

author: Helen Frost
text: Two boys (Anikwa, a member of the Miami tribe, and James, a trader's son) are friends living near the border of the American and British territories. On the eve of the War of 1812 their worlds are about to clash—and things will never be the same.
title: Salt: A Story of Friendship in a Time of War

author: Ann E. Burg
text: A young girl in rural Haiti dreams of becoming a doctor. But can she overcome extreme poverty and a devastating earthquake to make that dream come true?
title: Serafina's Promise

Publisher: Random House Books for Young Readers
author: Peggy Eddleman
text: In the post–World War III settlement of White Rock, invention is a way of life. Yet for Hope Torielli, even her best ideas go wrong. When bandits invade, Hope must save her community and discover where her true talents lie.
title: Sky Jumpers

author: Jessica Scott Kerrin
text: Stuck on cemetery duty for community service, Derek Knowles-Collier never expected to be tracking down clues scrawled in the margins of mystery novels. As he makes new discoveries, will he be able to put his own haunted memories to rest?
title: The Spotted Dog Last Seen
tagsold: Tearjerkers, Mystery, Identity, School, Realism, eBook

author: Josh Berk
text: Twelve-year-old Lenny's chance to be a real baseball announcer goes off the rails when a major league pitcher drops dead on the mound. Is it just a coincidence—or is it murder?
title: Strike Three, You're Dead

author: Kathi Appelt
text: Raccoon brothers Bingo and J'miah are facing a heap o' trouble. It's up to them to wake up the mythical Sugar Man and save the swamp from wild hogs and gator wrestling arenas. The problem? No one knows where he is.
title: The True Blue Scouts of Sugar Man Swamp

author: Megan Frazer Blakemore
text: What mysteries will Ephraim, Mallory, and Will uncover at the Appledores' ancestral home? Hidden tunnels, covert experiments, and old feuds await when they unravel the secrets of the past.
title: The Water Castle
tagsold: Families, Sci Fi, Fantasy, Mystery, eBook

author: Rob Lloyd Jones
text: He might be part of a Victorian freak show, but he has a deductive mind worthy of Sherlock Holmes. When Wild Boy is framed for a brutal murder, he must put all his sleuthing skills to the test to clear his name and uncover the real killer.
title: Wild Boy

author: Matthew Cody
text: Will escapes from the Manor after the murder of his uncle, and his life is irrevocably changed. When he's captured by outlaws in nearby Sherwood Forest, can he enlist their aid in his quest for revenge?
title: Will in Scarlet
tagsold: Folklore, Friendship, History, Identity, Adventure, Family, eBook

Publisher: Random House Books for Young Readers
author: Rosanne Parry
text: After her parents die, Pearl struggles to survive and learn more about her Northwest Coastal Makah heritage. When a supposed "art collector" from New York arrives with a devastating agenda, Pearl must find a way to protect the best interests of her tribe.
title: Written in Stone
tagsold: Multicultural, History, Girls, Identity, Tales of Courage

author: Kevin Henkes
text: How hard can second grade be? Four heartwarming vignettes illustrate the challenges and surprises of Billy's school year, from diorama drama to writing poetry in honor of his mother.
title: The Year of Billy Miller

author: Matt Phelan
text: When his town becomes the summer retreat for a troupe of vaudevillians, a young boy befriends 12-year-old Buster Keaton, who will one day become a legendary silent film star.
title: Bluffton

author: Extraordinary Cartoonists edite
text: Graphic artists such as Charise Mericle Harper, Brett Helquist, and Raina Telgemeier inventively reimagine such classics as Snow White, Puss in Boots, and more.
title: Fairy Tale Comics: Classic Tales Told

author: Luke Pearson
text: A country girl moves to the big city and meets a magical creature while trying to find her way back to her new home. Gorgeous autumnal hues and panoramic streetscapes pull you into her strange new world.
title: Hilda and the Bird Parade

author: Fanny Britt
text: The drab world of sad, bullied Hélène takes on fresh life and Colors thanks to a friendly, bright red fox and Jane Eyre. Colors added to black-and-white ink-wash illustrations reflect Hélène's rising confidence.
title: Jane, the Fox & Me

author: Rob Harrell
text: The only thing worse than living in Stover-on-Avon is being Rayburn, the depressed creature responsible for terrorizing it. With the help of a disgraced scientist, a plucky newsboy, and a "successful" behemoth, Rayburn sets out to be the best worst monster he can possibly be.
title: Monster on the Hill

author: Nathan Hale
text: Come for the cannibalism, stay for the individual stories and relentless, ridiculous bad luck. Savor this delicious adventure, based on a true story, peppered with juicy details and slapstick wit.
title: Nathan Hale's Hazardous Tales: Donner Dinner Party

author: A. J. Lieberman
text: A group of seemingly unconnected orphans sets out to fight an evil interplanetary corporation in this story filled with twists, turns, and clues galore.
title: The Silver Six
tagsold: Sci Fi, School, Friendship, Heroism, Quests

author: Jeffrey Brown
text: Young Roan Novachez is starting school, where he learns to expect the unexpected. Read this book, you must. Become a Jedi, you will.
title: Star Wars: Jedi Academy
tagsold: Sci Fi, Humor, School, Friendship, Boys

author: Leon Leyson
text: The youngest Holocaust survivor on Oskar Schindler's famous list tells his story at last—bringing a child's perspective to the Nazi occupation of Kraków and the remarkable courage needed to live through those horrifying times.
title: The Boy on the Wooden Box: How the Impossible Became Possible... on Schindler's List
tagsold: History, True Story, Heroism, Tearjerkers, eBook

author: Deborah Heiligman
text: Awkward outsider Paul Erdos became one of the most influential mathematicians of his time. Complex illustrations show us the world as Paul saw it—with math everywhere!
title: The Boy Who Loved Math: The Improbable Life of Paul Erdos

author: Rebecca Stern and Brad Wolfe
text: Some of your favorite authors take on the dreaded essay assignment. Once you read about time travel, video games, and the afterlife, you'll never fear this onerous task again.
title: Breakfast on Mars and 37 Other Delectable Essays edited

author: Charles R. Smith, Jr
text: Did you know that slaves helped build the White House? This poignant, visually compelling work told in verse chronicles what went into constructing one of the most famous buildings in the world, piece by piece...brick by brick.
title: Brick by Brick

author: Sandra Markle
text: Without honeybees, we would be eating only oats, rice, and corn. Now bees are disappearing in large numbers each year. Investigate why.
title: The Case of the Vanishing Honeybees: A Scientific Mystery
tagsold: Animals, Nature, Mystery, True Story, eBook

author: Tanya Lee Stone
text: An expertly researched and deftly written account of soldiers who fought for their country in spite of segregation on the home front and among their ranks.
title: Courage Has No Colors, The True Story of the Triple Nickles: America's First Black Paratroopers
tagsold: True Story, Heroism, Multicultural, Tales of Courage, eBook

author: Meghan McCarthy
text: If it could go fast, Betty June Skelton was there. Meet one woman who never said no to adventure.
title: Daredevil: The Daring Life of Betty Skelton

author: Jacqueline Briggs Martin
text: No space? No problem. Poor soil? We'll find a solution. A former basketball star turns an empty lot into a garden—and doesn't stop there.
title: Farmer Will Allen and the Growing Table

author: Brenda Z. Guiberson
text: Gorgeously detailed, Colors-saturated illustrations bring to life all kinds of frog species, from the scarlet-sided pobblebonk to others that carry babies in their mouths.
title: Frog Song

author: Lita Judge
text: They were really small—and really big! And superstar T. rex wasn't even the biggest. How would dinosaurs stack up to the animals of today?
title: How Big Were Dinosaurs?

author: Lois Miner Huey
text: Take a trip to colonial America but make sure you pack soap, toilet paper, a toothbrush, and hand sanitizer. Life was smelly, dirty, and buggy!
title: Ick! Yuck! Eew!: Our Gross American History

author: Brian Floca
text: A family travels along the steel rails of the newly opened transcontinental railroad. Hear the sounds, see the sights, and take an amazing journey over mountains, through plains, and finally to the sea.
title: Locomotive
tagsold: Families, History, Quests, Things That Go

Publisher: Little, Brown Books for Young Readers
author: Andrea Davis Pinkney
text: Spoken-word-style prose evokes the lives of these two greats. From their childhoods to the historic March on Washington, Pinkney's art conveys the feeling of the times.
title: Martin & Mahalia: His Words, Her Song
tagsold: History, Tales of Courage, Challenges, Friendship, Multicultural

author: Marfe Ferguson Delano
text: Photos of modern reenactors enliven another side of America's first president in this account of George Washington's change from slave owner to abolitionist sympathizer.
title: Master George's People: George Washington, His Slaves, and His Revolutionary Transformation

author: David A. Kelly
text: "What's the secret to the perfect baseball? You just need a little mud..."
title: Miracle Mud: Lena Blackburne and the Secret Mud That Changed Baseball

author: Jennifer Berne
text: Young Albert Einstein didn't talk until he was three, but the gift of a compass taught him to question everything. Find out how he grew up to become an internationally celebrated scientist!
title: On a Beam of Light: A Story of Albert Einstein

author: Margaret Weitekamp and David DeVorkin
text: Once a planet, always a planet? Maybe not. Just ask Pluto.
title: Pluto's Secret: An Icy World's Tale of Discovery

author: Jen Bryant
text: African-American artist Horace Pippin became a full-time painter after he was injured in World War I. A Colorsful account of Pippin's life and work.
title: A Splash of Red: The Life and Art of Horace Pippin
tagsold: True Story, Tales of Courage, Multicultural, Colors

author: Doreen Rappaport
text: A small, sickly boy grows up to become a visionary president who approached all things with energy, enthusiasm and an eye toward benefiting all.
title: To Dare Mighty Things: The Life of Theodore Roosevelt

author: H. Joseph Hopkins
text: Follow science teacher Kate Sessions on her search for plants that would prosper in San Diego's harsh desert climate.
title: The Tree Lady: The True Story of How One Tree-Loving Woman Changed a City Forever

author: Elizabeth Rusch
text: Mixed-media art captures the explosive power of a volcano as it creates underwater mountains and newly fertile islands.
title: Volcano Rising

author: Ann Downer
text: Flying foxes in the park? A coyote in a sandwich shop? Find out what happens when nature's creatures decide to adapt to city life.
title: Wild Animal Neighbors: Sharing Our Urban World
